abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Education Project
            (PASEN) for Nicaragua aim to: (a) improve institutional
            management capacity and information systems to improve
            service delivery; (b) improve systems of governance and
            accountability, including measures to strengthen community
            participation in the education sector; (c) improve the
            quality of education through monitoring and disseminating
            student learning outcomes; and (d) harmonize donor
            assistance in the education sector. The extension is
            necessary to complete the purchase, printing and
            distribution of goods financed by the project. This
            includes: (i) the purchase of two computer server units to
            improve the efficiency of the Ministry of Education (MINED)
            network system; books for distribution to school libraries
            for primary; other learning materials for distribution to
            secondary non-formal education; school supplies for
            distribution to primary schools in the non-formal education
            system and 16 laptops for the Primary and Teacher Training
            Directorates of MINED; and (ii) the printing of learning
            materials (guides, brochures, curriculum materials, and
            learning aids) for distribution to primary school teachers
            and school administrators. MINED has prepared a plan of
            action for completion of these activities prior to the
            revised closing date. This will be the third extension of
            the project, bringing the total cumulative extension to
            three years.
